snippet: Critics, journalists and activists are divided over the suggestion that calculated infliction of pain and fear may have produced useful clues in hunt for Osama bin Laden.
abstract: Critics, journalists and activists who have watched early screenings of Zero Dark Thirty, movie about the hunt for Osama bin Laden, are divided over suggestion that calculated and brutal Central Intelligence Agency interrogation techniques may have produced useful clues in hunt for the terrorist leader; classified Senate report is said to have found that torture was not a central component in finding Bin Laden, but topic is fodder for partisan fight.
lead_paragraph: Critics, journalists and activists are divided over the suggestion that calculated infliction of pain and fear may have produced useful clues in hunt for Osama bin Laden.

headline.seo: ‘Zero Dark Thirty’ Torture Scenes Reopen Debate
headline.main: Portrayal of C.I.A. Torture in Bin Laden Film Reopens a Debate
headline.print_headline: Portrayal of C.I.A. Torture in Bin Laden Film Reopens a Debate
